label: 兵部省
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Ministry (shō) in charge of all military affairs.  The retainers (toneri) or guards of the Office of the Empress' Household (Chūgūshiki ), the Crown Prince's Quarters (Tōgūbō ), and the Six Headquarters of the Guards (Rokuefu ), the guards at the gate of the Bureau of the High Priestess of the Ise-daijingū (Saigūryō ), the imperial guards (eji ), the Coast Guards (Sakimori ), the provincial guards (kondei ), the Pacifying-Ezo Headquarters (Chinjufu ), the guards of the Government Headquarters in Kyūshū (Dazaifu) and of the various provincial (kuni) governments. Lists, promotions, and demotions of all military officials; problems of defense,military equipment, etc.  [舎人、中宮識、東宮房、六衛府、斎宮寮、衛士、防人、建児、鎮守府、太宰府、国]
